body:
**If this issue affects you, please react with a üëç (thumbs up emoji) to the initial post.**

Your feedback helps us prioritize which bugs to investigate and address first.

![Visits](https://hits.seeyoufarm.com/api/count/incr/badge.svg?url=https%3A%2F%2Fgithub.com%2Fstreamlit%2Fstreamlit%2Fissues%2F9284&title=visits&edge_flat=false)

performed_via_github_app.name: GitHub Actions
performed_via_github_app.description: Automate your workflow from idea to production

body:
Hey @connortann , thank you for the thorough analysis here. Wonder if you can share sample set of requests made.

We do delete the cookie if there's a connection change to anything other than connected. When that happens, the frontend will make a health request from the server to re-retrieve the cookie. So based on this, I would assume the health request is not being made for some reason. Curious if there's an error, or if it is simply reconnecting...before anything can happen (which seems weird). Curious if the network logs shows that request being made and the cookie being provided.

Hi @kmcgrady , thanks for the reply. Here's are some screenshot of the network logs. Please let me know if there is any other info you need.

### Initial page load

First, here are the logs from an initial page load (when I haven't yet logged into Azure).

Nb. there appear to be two "health" requests, I think because I am in the context of a multi-page app. The first is to `http://localhost:8501/bug/_stcore/health`, which returns `404`, but then a second health request to `http://localhost:8501/_stcore/health` succeeds with `304`

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/4ed4f3b9-5399-4c1c-89a5-3f0dd4a89fe3)

### The popup interaction

Then, here are the network logs from when I use the popup interaction to login. There don't appear to be any health requests.

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/90a6bd63-2aad-4b10-b099-f046c676943a)

### Screencast

Here is a screencast of the whole thing, showing the cookie disappearing and the network tab. The "login" popup isn't recorded in the screencast.

[cookie-bug-2.webm](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/328d874c-6a8e-4d0b-b622-f05feba164d2)

Hey hey @connortann !

I removed the line that deletes cookie value on the frontend in this PR https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/pull/9304 

Could you please verify that it solves that problem for you?

You can download the wheel file from here https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/actions/runs/10472360125?pr=9304 (it is a build step associated with this PR) under the Artifacts tab. 

Please let us know if it works for you

@kajarenc sure, I'll do that when I get a chance, probably tomorrow. I think I already checked with a local build (together with @dannyopts ) that the cookie is _not_ deleted if one comments out that particular line `setCookie("_streamlit_xsrf", "")`
@kajarenc yep, I confirmed the bug does not occur when using the wheel file linked above.

issue.title: Remove `_streamlit_xsrf` cookie value replacement with empty string

repository.name: streamlit
repository.description: Streamlit ‚Äî A faster way to build and share data apps.

issue.body:
## Describe your changes
Remove `_streamlit_xsrf` cookie value replacement with empty string on reconnect

This PR should not introduce any new security issues since we do not replace an already-set cookie with an empty string from JS (the browser will replace it with a new value once it is received).
In the current state (before merging PR) the old cookie value is available from JS anyway.
 
## GitHub Issue Link (if applicable)
Closes #9284

## Testing Plan

- Explanation of why no additional tests are needed
- Unit Tests (JS and/or Python)
- E2E Tests
- Any manual testing needed?

---

**Contribution License Agreement**

By submitting this pull request you agree that all contributions to this project are made under the Apache 2.0 license.
